data.Sentence_cn: 死于公元前800年的一位埃及妇女的木乃伊刚刚接受了一次手术。
data.Sentence: The mummy of an Egyptian woman who died in 800 B.C. has just had an operation.

data.Sentence_cn: 这是曾在底比斯神殿里当过歌手的赛潘姆特的木乃伊。
data.Sentence: The mummy is that of Shepenmut who was once a singer in the Temple of Thebes.

data.Sentence_cn: 由于在给这个木乃伊拍摄的X光片子上有点奇怪的斑点，
data.Sentence: As there were strange marks on the X-ray plates taken of the mummy,

data.Sentence_cn: 所以，医生们一直试图搞清这位妇女是否死于一种罕见的疾病。
data.Sentence: doctors have been trying to find out whether the woman died of a rare disease.

data.Sentence_cn: 搞清的唯一办法就是手术。
data.Sentence: The only way to do this was to operate.

data.Sentence_cn: 手术持续了4个多小时，非常难做，因为皮肤上覆盖着一层硬硬的树脂。
data.Sentence: The operation, which lasted for over four hours, proved to be very difficult because of the hard resin which covered the skin.

data.Sentence_cn: 医生们从木乃伊身上取下一个切片，送去化验。
data.Sentence: The doctors removed a section of the mummy and sent it to a laboratory.

data.Sentence_cn: 他们还发现了X光片所没有显示的东西：一个蜡制的杜瓦木特夫神小塑像。
data.Sentence: They also found something which the X-ray plates did not show: a small wax figure of the god Duamutef.

data.Sentence_cn: 这种牛头人身的神像通常被放在木乃伊体内。
data.Sentence: This god which has the head of a cow was normally placed inside a mummy.

data.Sentence_cn: 医生们至今还未确定这位妇女的死因。
data.Sentence: The doctors have not yet decided how the woman died.

data.Sentence_cn: 他们曾担心在把木乃伊切开后，它会散成碎片，但幸运得很，这种情况并未发生。
data.Sentence: They feared that the mummy would fall to pieces when they cut it open, but fortunately this has not happened.

data.Sentence_cn: 这具木乃伊成功地经受了这次手术。
data.Sentence: The mummy successfully survived the operation.
